meanings.definition: Having or representing the earth as a center, as in former astronomical systems.
meanings.sent1: The geocentric model placed Earth at the center of the universe.
meanings.sent2: The ancient Greeks believed in a geocentric view of the cosmos.
meanings.sent3: In the geocentric model, Earth thought it was the star of the show!
meanings.sent4: Her geocentric perspective made her feel like the most important person in the room.
meanings.sent5: The geocentric theory was once widely accepted before modern astronomy.

meanings.definition: Considering the earth as the center of a system.
meanings.sent1: The geocentric theory was a common belief in ancient times.
meanings.sent2: Many early civilizations had a geocentric view of the universe.
meanings.sent3: The geocentric idea made Earth feel like the star of the celestial neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: His geocentric mindset limited his understanding of the vast universe.
meanings.sent5: The geocentric perspective shaped early astronomical observations.
